subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Umar and the Rapid Expansion
description: A quick win: understand Umar and the Rapid Expansion.

hook.text: In ten years, Islam conquered an area larger than Rome took centuries to build. Umar's expansion was history's fastest.

buildup.text: Caliph Umar (634-644) conquered Persia, Egypt, Syria, and Iraq. Two ancient empires fell in a single decade.

discovery.text: Umar's armies offered three choices: convert, pay a tax, or fight. Many chose the tax and kept their faith.

twist.text: Umar was famously humble. He patched his own clothes and slept under trees. The world's most powerful man lived simply.

climax.text: Umar built the administrative systems that governed the Islamic world for centuries. Conquest was just the beginning.

punchline.text: Umar conquered empires in a decade. Then he built systems to govern them.

quiz.question: What was Caliph Umar known for?
options: Rapid military expansion and administrative systems
